sections.heading: Employers affected by fellow servant act
sections.text: 769.02Liability of certain persons and corporations for injuries from negligence of fellow servants.769.03Recovery for injuries where employee and employer both at fault; damages; negligence of fellow servant.769.04Doctrine of “assumption of risk” abrogated.769.05Proce

sections.heading: Liability of certain persons and corporations for injuries from negligence of fellow servants.
sections.text: of certain persons and corporations for injuries from negligence of fellow servants.

sections.heading: Recovery for injuries where employee and employer both at fault; damages; negligence of fellow servant.
sections.text: for injuries where employee and employer both at fault; damages; negligence of fellow servant.

sections.heading: Doctrine of “assumption of risk” abrogated.
sections.text: 769.04 Doctrine of “assumption of risk” abrogated.—The doctrine of “assumption of risk” shall not obtain in any case arising under the provisions of this chapter, where the injury or death was attributable to the negligence of the employer, his or her agents or servants. History.—s. 4, ch. 6521, 1913; RGS 4974; CGL 7061; s. 1177, ch. 97-102. sections.heading: Proceeds of recovery for injuries exempt from garnishment and execution.
sections.text: of recovery for injuries exempt from garnishment and execution.

sections.heading: Contracts limiting liability invalid.
sections.text: 769.06 Contracts limiting liability invalid.—Any contract, contrivance or device whatever, having the effect to relieve or exempt the persons mentioned in s. 769.01 from the liability prescribed by this chapter shall be illegal and void. History.—s. 6, ch. 6521, 1913; RGS 4976; CGL 7063.
